column5: I don't have a name for this place but it is referred to as being about 5 minutes from Wabaskang Lake. Is anybody familiar with its hours of operation & menu & quality? Such as soup/sandwich place or full steak dinners? Thanks for any info, Jay

Last year the restraunt was closed and for sale. Some of the resorts around the area offer meals and you might be able to get a home cooked meal if prior arrangements are made. Otherwise the the restraunts are either in Ear falls or back in Vermillion Bay. Dutchies general store offers some grocery items.
Thanks for the info. I guess I'll be bringing up my own steaks. Its all good as long as I get there. Again Thank You, Jay
After doing some more checking I have been told that this place is indeed for sale & has been for many years but is OPEN Monday-Friday. Just wanted to clarify this for one & all. Later, Jay

The restaurant is the Sunset. It is open weekdays from 6am to 9pm if memory serves me right. It has a tavern licence and you can get a beer or drink with your meal if so desired. It has everything on the menu from burgers to pork chops to fish and chips. it has the best coffee along the highway. Hope this helps
Thanks for the information. I will be trying it out the week of August 11th. Later, Jay
Guess driving by on Sat/Sunday explains the empty parking lot!
